locations.name: Hau'oli Outskirts
locations.description: An area located between Hau'oli City and Route 1. You can catch a whiff of salt on the southerly winds.

locations.name: Iki Town
locations.description: An old town where traditions have been passed on for generations. The villagers here are close with Tapu Koko.

locations.name: Hau'oli City
locations.description: A popular spot where locals like to gather. Even people from other towns come to Hau'oli City to visit this beach. The center of the city, where more and more people have become fashion conscious to take commemorative photos. A harbor where you can set out for the other islands. It's visited by many people and boats.

locations.name: Heahea City
locations.description: Considered the "front door" to Akala Island, this town's residents treasure visitors and welcome them most warmly.

locations.name: Paniola Town
locations.description: A town located in the middle of Akala Island and surrounded by ranch land and pastures for grazing.

locations.name: Konikoni City
locations.description: This is a city of merchants, where you find lots of shops and even a photo club, beyond the gate at the entrance.

locations.name: Malie City
locations.description: A city with an obvious Eastern influence in its design. The architecture is distinctive here. Its cape is famous for its Recycling Plant. The plant is co-managed by people and Pokémon.

locations.name: Tapu Village
locations.description: The remains of a village said to have been destroyed by the island's tapu when the people roused its anger.

locations.name: Po Town
locations.description: A town barricaded with tall walls that seem to reach the sky. It is occupied by Team Skull.

locations.name: Seafolk Village
locations.description: The village of a wandering people who live on ships. They all seem to love living free and unfettered.

locations.name: Pokémon League
locations.description: The place where the most powerful Trainer in the Alola region will be decided. Coming soon!

locations.name: Route 1
locations.description: This beautiful path filled with flora connects Iki Town at its north end to Hau'oli City in the south.

locations.name: Route 2
locations.description: A path that leads to the northern part of Melemele Island. It's famous for being a training ground for the local Trainers.

locations.name: Route 3
locations.description: A steep mountain path surrounded by rocks where a lot of bird Pokémon live.

locations.name: Route 4
locations.description: A route that connects Heahea City and Paniola Town. The gentle touch of nature is abundant here.

locations.name: Route 5
locations.description: A winding route with many branching paths and ledges. It is quite challenging for people traveling on foot.

locations.name: Route 6
locations.description: A plain and straight route that leads through the middle of Akala Island. It is also known by the name "Straight Street."

locations.name: Route 7
locations.description: A route that takes you to Wela Volcano Park. It makes anyone sweat from the heat of the volcano.

locations.name: Route 8
locations.description: An oceanside route with great views. It is a popular date spot enjoyed by many couples and Pokémon.

locations.name: Route 9
locations.description: A short route constructed by the local Diglett with whatever strength they had remaining after digging Diglett's Tunnel.

locations.name: Route 10
locations.description: A gladed path filled with the nests of many Pokémon. It leads to the road that can take you to the top of Mount Hokulani.

locations.name: Route 11
locations.description: One of the routes that connects Malie City with the nature surrounding it. This one leads to a rough mountain trail.

locations.name: Route 12
locations.description: A route full of rugged boulders that present a difficult challenge to anyone who hopes to pass through it.

locations.name: Route 13
locations.description: A route considered by many to be a place to take a break before taking on Haina Desert.

locations.name: Route 14
locations.description: An old route that leads to a trial site. Its beach is famous for its unique black sand.

locations.name: Route 15
locations.description: A water route that lies on the western coast of Ula'ula Island. People often rely on Pokémon to traverse it.

locations.name: Route 16
locations.description: Trainers all take a little break at the Pokémon Center here before they proceed to Ula'ula Meadow.

locations.name: Route 17
locations.description: The rain never stops falling in sheets on this route. This path always seems to inspire a sense of unease.

locations.name: Mahalo Trail
locations.description: A mountainous trail that leads to the sacred ruins. The cool air up here is very soothing on the skin.

locations.name: Trainers' School
locations.description: A school just outside of Hau'oli City where young Trainers can learn how to battle with Pokémon.

locations.name: Hau'oli Cemetery
locations.description: The people and Pokémon on Melemele Island share their lives, and here they have also shared their graves for generations.

locations.name: Berry Fields
locations.description: A Berry field with soft soil. It is the pride and joy of the local Berry master.

locations.name: Verdant Cavern
locations.description: A cave with a great variety of plants thriving inside it. The light shafting in from above makes for a breathtaking sight.

locations.name: Melemele Meadow
locations.description: A place where yellow flowers bloom in abundance. You can gather the nectar Oricorio loves to feed on here.

locations.name: Seaward Cave
locations.description: A cave that connects Melemele Meadow and Kala'e Bay. It is filled with salty smell of the sea.

locations.name: Kala'e Bay
locations.description: One of the most scenic spots on Melemele Island. It was chosen as one of the top 100 views in Alola.

locations.name: Ten Carat Hill
locations.description: A great hill formed by the activity of an underwater volcano. It is famous for the hollow in its middle that is open to the air.

locations.name: Paniola Ranch
locations.description: The ranch managed together by the people and Pokémon living in Paniola Town.

locations.name: Brooklet Hill
locations.description: The best fishing spot in the Alola region. Its series of cascading waterfalls make it look like a terrace field.

locations.name: Melemele Sea
locations.description: The vast sea spreads, and various Pokémon live among rocks. The sea is crowded with Melemele islanders, local Pokémon, and visiting tourists all year round.

locations.name: Diglett's Tunnel
locations.description: Diglett and people worked together to finish digging this tunnel several years ago.

locations.name: Royal Avenue
locations.description: A major street that has developed so much thanks to the Battle Royal Dome being on it, making it look like a city street.

locations.name: Wela Volcano Park
locations.description: A mountain with steep paths and waste lands. There is a trial site on top.

locations.name: Lush Jungle
locations.description: A heavily wooded tropical rain forest. It's famous for producing ingredients for delicious meals.

locations.name: Memorial Hill
locations.description: A place where the memories of people and Pokémon linger. Many people come from other islands to visit this graveyard.

locations.name: Akala Outskirts
locations.description: A grassy stretch along Akala's southern-most coast. It leads from Memorial Hill to the Ruins of Life.

locations.name: Ruins of Life
locations.description: The ruins that enshrine Tapu Lele, one of the land spirits. It is said that life is born here.

locations.name: Hano Grand Resort
locations.description: The biggest of all the resorts in the Alola region. The hotel is fully booked a year in advance. Everybody talks about this five-star hotel.

locations.name: Hano Beach
locations.description: The beach near Hano Grand Hotel at the Hano Grand Resort. Pyukumuku-chucking is a popular part-time job to do here.

locations.name: Malie Garden
locations.description: A well-manicured garden located in the middle of Malie City. The large lake within it seems to resemble something...

locations.name: Mount Hokulani
locations.description: A mountain suitable for observing the stars. There is an observatory on top.

locations.name: Hokulani Observatory
locations.description: A research facility for observing and studying various phenomena in space.

locations.name: Blush Mountain
locations.description: The mountain where the Geothermal Power Plant is situated. Its output covers almost all of Ula'ula Island's electric needs.

locations.name: Ula'ula Beach
locations.description: A beach that spreads on the southern coast of Ula'ula Island. A very popular and busy place for Mantine Surf.

locations.name: Aether House
locations.description: The Aether Foundation's largest base on Alola's main islands, with one of its purposes being an orphanage for human children and Pokémon. Its headmaster is an Oranguru.

locations.name: Thrifty Megamart (Abandoned Site)
locations.description: The original site of the first Thrifty Megamart store. It is said to have been destroyed by the island's tapu.

locations.name: Haina Desert
locations.description: A scorching-hot desert beyond Route 13. Trainers often get lost here in this broiling labyrinth.

locations.name: Ruins of Abundance
locations.description: The ruins that enshrine Tapu Bulu, one of the land spirits. It is said that life grows here.

locations.name: Ula'ula Meadow
locations.description: A place where red flowers bloom in abundance. You can gather the nectar Oricorio loves to feed on here.

locations.name: Lake of the Moone
locations.description: A place that seems to have some connection to the Alola's Legendary Pokémon. The lake forms a perfect circle.

locations.name: Lake of the Sunne
locations.description: A place that seems to have some connection to the Alola's Legendary Pokémon. The lake forms a perfect circle.

locations.name: Shady House
locations.description: A mansion abandoned by a certain rich citizen. People sometimes call it the "Shady Chateau," too.

locations.name: Poni Wilds
locations.description: The entrance to Poni Island. It connects to Seafolk Village.

locations.name: Ancient Poni Path
locations.description: An old path that leads to Vast Poni Canyon. Some people and Pokémon still try to live in the ruins here, but not many.

locations.name: Poni Breaker Coast
locations.description: The southern coast of Poni Island, where rough waves pound mercilessly upon the shore.

locations.name: Ruins of Hope
locations.description: The ruins that enshrine Tapu Fini, one of the land spirits. It is said that life ends its journey here.

locations.name: Exeggutor Island
locations.description: It's a paradise for Exeggutor! This island is designated as a special preserve.

locations.name: Vast Poni Canyon
locations.description: The most challenging path on Poni Island. The ups and downs of this canyon are beyond any other.

locations.name: Altar of the Sunne
locations.description: An altar that is said to be closely associated with the Legendary Pokémon depicted in the local folklore.

locations.name: Altar of the Moone
locations.description: An altar that is said to be closely associated with the Legendary Pokémon depicted in the local folklore.

locations.name: Mount Lanakila
locations.description: The roughest and coldest mountain in the Alola region. A large-scale construction project has been taken up here.

locations.name: Ruins of Conflict
locations.description: The ruins that enshrine Tapu Koko, one of the land spirits. It is said that life is tested here.

locations.name: Poni Grove
locations.description: A natural path that winds among the many trees. It leads to the eastern side of Poni Island.

locations.name: Poni Plains
locations.description: The plains that lead to the northern part of Poni island. There is also a path connecting to Poni Meadow from here.

locations.name: Poni Meadow
locations.description: A place where purple flowers bloom in abundance. You can gather the nectar Oricorio loves to feed on here.

locations.name: Poni Meadow
locations.description: A cave that leads deep, deep down under the ground. How it got the name "resolution" is not known.

locations.name: Poni Coast
locations.description: The north-eastern coast of Poni Island, where the clarity of the water makes it a popular view spot.

locations.name: Poni Gauntlet
locations.description: A difficult path that leads to the Battle Tree. It's full of tough Trainers.

locations.name: Battle Tree
locations.description: The sacred battle grounds for the toughest Trainers of the Alola region.

locations.name: Big Wave Beach
locations.description: A beach with huge waves. It's located near a motel. It's one of the Mantine Surf Spots.

locations.name: Sandy Cave
locations.description: The vast sea spreads, and various Pokémon live among rocks.

locations.name: Heahea Beach
locations.description: A bustling beach connecting to Heahea City. It's one of the Mantine Surf Spots.

locations.name: Pikachu Valley
locations.description: Pikachu Valley is a small enclosure on Akala Island where wild Pikachu gather to interact with others.

locations.name: Dividing Peak Tunnel
locations.description: A tunnel that connects Route 7 to Route 8.

locations.name: Poni Beach
locations.description: A beach on Poni Island with an abundance of nature. It's one of the Mantine Surf Spots.

locations.name: Plains Grotto
locations.description: Plains Grotto is a circular cave with several rock formations and a pedestal in the center.

locations.name: Aether Paradise
locations.description: A VLFS or a "very large floating structure." This is where the Aether Foundation's research facilities are.

locations.name: Ultra Space
locations.description: An interdimensional spatial realm filled with crystalline meteoroids. It links to a number of different universes and dimensions through Ultra Wormholes.

locations.name: Ultra Deep Sea
locations.description: A sea located deep in the unknowns of Ultra Space.

locations.name: Ultra Megalopolis
locations.description: An alien city located far in the unknowns of Ultra Space. Necrozma prevents any natural light from reaching this world.

locations.name: Megalo Tower
locations.description: Located in the heart of Ultra Megalopolis, this tower provides artifical light to the city.

locations.name: Ultra Jungle
locations.description: A junle located deep in the unknowns of Ultra Space.

locations.name: Ultra Desert
locations.description: A desert located deep in the unknowns of Ultra Space.

locations.name: Ultra Plant
locations.description: An alien power plant located deep in the unknowns of Ultra Space.

locations.name: Ultra Forest
locations.description: A forest located deep in the unknowns of Ultra Space.

locations.name: Ultra Crater
locations.description: A crater located deep in the unknowns of Ultra Space.

locations.name: Ultra Ruin
locations.description: An alien ruin located deep in the unknowns of Ultra Space.
